basejump
  • Reference

Collapse utilities

Helper functions for to produce collapsed output for vectors (toString()) and data frames (summarizeRows()]).

toStringUnique(x, sep = ", ")

toStringSortUnique(x, sep = ", ")

summarizeRows(x, sep = ", ")

Arguments

x

The object to be converted.
sep

Separator used for collapse.

Value

A character vector of length 1 is returned.

Examples

toStringUnique(c("milk", "eggs", "eggs", NA))
#> [1] "milk, eggs"
toStringSortUnique(c("milk", "eggs", "eggs", NA))
#> [1] "eggs, milk"

mtcars %>% head %>% summarizeRows
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>                          mpg     cyl                    disp                hp
#>                        <chr>   <chr>                   <chr>             <chr>
#> 1 18.1, 18.7, 21, 21.4, 22.8 4, 6, 8 108, 160, 225, 258, 360 93, 105, 110, 175
#> # ... with 7 more variables: drat <chr>, wt <chr>, qsec <chr>, vs <chr>,
#> #   am <chr>, gear <chr>, carb <chr>
